description: {"blocks":[{"key":"bs7v7","text":"This protocol describes the extraction and targeted mass spectrometry analysis of two drugs - paracetamol and AT7519, a CKDI inhibitor, following enrichment with isotopically labelled internal standards of deuterated versions of the two drugs.  Extraction of the drugs was carried out using automated protein precipitation on a liquid handling robot alongside a calibration curve. Analysis of the extract was carried out by liquid chromatography mass spectrometry (LC-MS/MS) in multiple reaction mode. The amount of each drug (APAP and AT7519) in each sample was calculated using linear regression of the peak area ratio of the analytes to the isotopically labelled internal standards. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"226o9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4t9g3","text":"This protocol was published as part of: J Cartwright, J P Simpson, NZM Homer, Adriano Rossi ‘Analysis of AT7519 as a pro-resolution compound in an acetaminophen-induced mouse model of acute inflammation by UPLC-MS/MS’, J. Inflammation (2023)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"6kekj","text":"Use analytical grade, LC or LC-MS grade solutions and solvents, as detailed in Materials section. Use certified reference materials where detailed. Use the dilution scheme as described to ensure linear calibration curves.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

entries.section: Prepare calibration standard and Quality Control stock solutions
Prepare calibration standard and Quality Control stock solutions

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: Extract calibration standard & Quality Control and samples by PPT
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9ciop","text":"Complete a plate map for standards, quality controls and samples (MAKE SURE TO PLACE THEM COLUMN-WISE!) using the design as shown below. The attached excel can be downloaded and filled in with sample specific detail for a real plate map and real samples - change the detail in the second tab (Sample List) and it will populate the plate map view, which you can print out and use at the bench.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":392,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6f3hu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"sfd5","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"E242CF80243511EE82586F671B054F64","id":390023,"original_name":"20230515_APAP_AT_MockPlateMap_Protocol_NZMH.xlsx","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m66hbm8pf.xlsx"}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"AE9F34C0243511EE82586F671B054F64","height":262,"id":391048,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"ftvnf\",\"text\":\"Plate Map Design for 96-well extraction including calibration standards, quality controls, double blanks and up to 77 biological samples per batch\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":0,\"length\":16}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m76kbm8pf.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m76ibm8pf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m76jbm8pf.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m76hbm8pf.webp","width":550}}}}

steps.section: Extract calibration standard & Quality Control and samples by PPT
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e9khu","text":" Defrost biological   and quality control samples (lower limite of quantitation (LLOQ_, low, med and high)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":20,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"capc2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"sample","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"blocks":null,"entityMap":null}}}}

steps.section: Extract calibration standard & Quality Control and samples by PPT
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"18ual","text":"Set up Extrahera liquid handling robot for PPT+ extraction:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extract calibration standard & Quality Control and samples by PPT
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1khrr","text":"Turn on Air Compressor. Make sure a pressure of ~9 bar is achieved and that the air compressor goes into Standby (indicated by green flashing light).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extract calibration standard & Quality Control and samples by PPT
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fltr0","text":"Turn on fume cupboard and make sure duct hose is in place in fume cupboard to ensure proper ventilation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extract calibration standard & Quality Control and samples by PPT
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cvsre","text":"Turn on Extrahera at plug and use twisting switch on right hand side  (turn it over 90 degrees to start it), and wait for it to boot up.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extract calibration standard & Quality Control and samples by PPT
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"112uc","text":"Once the touch screen is active, from the Maintenance menu select Flush Solvent Inlets and Purge line S3 with Acetonitrile","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":66,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extract calibration standard & Quality Control and samples by PPT
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"198lm","text":"Ensure that a sufficient number of solvent tips (deck position 1) and sample tips (deck position 2) are on the deck. For a full plate you will need 96 tips.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":116,"length":40}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extract calibration standard & Quality Control and samples by PPT
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"87fiv","text":"Place a PPT+ plate (Biotage) in deck position 3. Make sure that it is in the correct orientation and is properly clicked in place.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extract calibration standard & Quality Control and samples by PPT
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9e7np","text":"Place a Waters 2mL 96 well collection plate in carousel position A (MAKE SURE WELL A1 IS ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE CAROUSEL NEXT TO THE A1 LABEL!).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extract calibration standard & Quality Control and samples by PPT
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"19hpm","text":"Take a Biotage 2mL deep well 96 well collection plate and add 100 uL 5% BSA solution to each of the standard wells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extract calibration standard & Quality Control and samples by PPT
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"373sm","text":"Add required amount of standards to the BSA according to the PREPARATION OF CALIBRATION STANDARDS table section. Due to the small volumes of standards being pipetted, ensure that the standard is pipetted INTO the BSA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extract calibration standard & Quality Control and samples by PPT
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fbnq8","text":" For sample, according to plate map, add 50 uL serum plus 50 uL of water to the appropriate wells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extract calibration standard & Quality Control and samples by PPT
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"68ojq","text":"To samples and standards add 20 uL of internal standard solution (Prepared according to Table - Internal Standard Preparation) using the repeater pipette (Choose 2.5 mL tip, set to 20 uL as above) to all relevant wells","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extract calibration standard & Quality Control and samples by PPT
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1b86u","text":" Seal the plate using a VWR 96 well plate sealing film and shake the plate on a plate shaker for 2 mins to ensure that the standards and internal standards are sufficiently mixed (shake speed - 200 rpm).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extract calibration standard & Quality Control and samples by PPT
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dvo60","text":"Remove the plate seal and place the sample plate on the deck of the Extrahera in position 4.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extract calibration standard & Quality Control and samples by PPT
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c110n","text":"Select Run Single Method from the Extrahera menu and select the DCA, PPT+ method then press Prepare Run. Select the columns of the PPT+ plate for processing, update the tip numbers/locations if necessary and top up the solvent reservoirs if necessary (when orange). Here you can also adjust the sample volume to fit with the amount you have used. For 100 uL of sample set to 150 uL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extract calibration standard & Quality Control and samples by PPT
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6cut1","text":"Press Run. The Extrahera loads 400 uL of Acetonitrile into each well. It then transfers the sample plate contents onto the acetonitrile in the PPT+ plate. Following a 10 min wait the Extrahera applies positive pressure to pass the samples through the PPT+ plate and collects the eluent in the Waters 2 mL deep well 96 well plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extract calibration standard & Quality Control and samples by PPT
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7r31m","text":"Once complete, check the volumes of elution solvent in the collection plate are approximately equal - indicating good performance of the positive pressure head. Check that the samples and standards were correctly aspirated from the sample plate. IF the volumes are not equal you may need to push through on the standalone positive pressure unit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extract calibration standard & Quality Control and samples by PPT
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f65li","text":"Place the extracted samples (in the collection plate) on the SPE Dry 96 Dual Sample Concentrator with the gas temperature set to 40°C and the highest flow it will achieve. steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9qihk","text":"Put plate of extracted samples into the correct position and once SST has shown good results, set the batch to run. Inject 10 μL for each sample. steps.section: Evaluation of LC-MS/MS data
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5pbpa","text":"Use Analyst Explore to view the total ion chromatogram. Extract APAP and d4-APAP and check retention times. Extract AT7519 and d8-AT5519 and check retention times. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Evaluation of LC-MS/MS data
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"62sel","text":"Open MultiQuant 3.0.3 and create a new result file. Select the data file collected. Save the result file with the file naming convention (yyymmdd_Exxxx_Analyte_initials). Use a method to evaluate the data that integrates APAP at 2.07 mins; AT7519 at 2.74 mins; d4-APAP at 2.04 mins and d8-AT7519 at 2.7 mins. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":5,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"581qc","text":"In MultiQuant 3.0.3 create a new result file, using the recently collected data file and name it using the file name convention above (yyyymmdd_Eyyxxxxx_Name_APAP-AT7519_initials). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":20,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Set up LC-MS/MS for analysis of extracts
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5h94i","text":"Start with divert valve going to waste, divert to mass spectrometer at 1 minute, then back to waste at 8 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":11,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ci0fs","text":"Assess the calibration curve for APAP and exclude any points that are outwith 20% accuracy. Aim for a linear regression coefficient of R\u003e0.99. Ensure at least 6 points on the curve","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fn4r5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c60pe","text":"Assess the calibration curve for AT7519 and exclude any points that are outwith 20% accuracy. Aim for a linear regression coefficient of R\u003e0.99. Ensure at least 6 points on the curve","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"706cm","text":"Assign correct sample type - Standards, Blanks, QCs and unknowns. Define standard and QC concentrations. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5mo5f","text":"Ensure all peaks have been integrated for APAP, d4APAP, AT7519 and d8AT7519. Check correct peaks have been picked by using the Metric plot function to compare 'Peak Area' of analyte and retention time over the course of the batch.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":127,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"26i2k","text":"Define the upper and lower limit of the method according to accuracy of the calibration curve and record this to assess the unknowns and how they sit within the method.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Evaluation of LC-MS/MS data
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"98ldn","text":"Define sample type - Blanks, Double Blanks, Standards, Unknowns (samples) and Solvents. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Evaluation of LC-MS/MS data
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8h04e","text":"Check all peaks have integrated for each analyte - use Metric plots to assess peak area and retention time to ensure correct peaks have been integrated","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":32},{"style":"bold","offset":55,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Evaluation of LC-MS/MS data
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b2vak","text":"Check calibration curves for accuracy (\u003c20%) and exclude those points that are outwith. Ensure there are over 6 points in each calibration curve and a regression coefficient R\u003e0.99","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Evaluation of LC-MS/MS data
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7rfn2","text":"Copy the data of all peaks and calculated amounts into Microsoft Excel and name the excel file using the  file naming convention (yyymmdd_Exxxx_Analyte_initials) and name the first tab 'RawData'","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Evaluation of LC-MS/MS data
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"35c1","text":"Create a new tab. Go back to 'Raw Data' select 'filter' and select the first analyte in the list (alphabetical). Copy this analyte excel data into the new tab and rename the tab with the analyte name. Repeat with all analytes until you have an excel spreadsheet with the following tabs - Raw Data; APAP 1; AT7519 1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Evaluation of LC-MS/MS data
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ak160","text":"In the two tabs for the analytes - rename 'calculated amount' on the APAP tab to '[APAP] ng' and rename in the AT7519 tab to '[AT7519] ng'","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Evaluation of LC-MS/MS data
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cj8jv","text":"Insert standard curve values and QC valules in 'actual amount' according to the calibration table and QC table. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
